reasoning:

A Full House needs three of a kind plus a pair. I have two pairs—Queens and Jacks—but no three of a kind to complete it. Drawing a third Queen or Jack is possible since only one of each remains in the deck, but I should consider my Full House card is at Level 9 with strong multipliers. If I can assemble a Full House using all four suits, I'd trigger Flower Pot. My best strategy is holding onto both pairs and discarding other cards to chase a third matching rank.

With just one hand remaining and needing 28,192 chips, I'm calculating whether a Full House with Flower Pot activation would suffice. The math shows around 20,160 chips—still short of my target. I realize I played a Straight last turn, which means Card Sharp would give me a x3 multiplier if I can play another Straight this hand.

Looking at my current cards, I have 8, 9, Jack, and Queen, but I'm missing the 10 needed to complete 8-9-10-J-Q. With three tens remaining in the 23-card deck, I should discard the cards that don't contribute to this sequence and hope to draw one of those tens. If I can assemble this Straight with all four suits represented, the chip calculation would be approximately 30 base chips plus card values around 47, plus the Blue Joker contribution, giving me enough to potentially reach my score threshold.

But even with that hand, I'm still falling short of what I need. The math is brutal—my current multiplier setup only gets me to around 4,428 chips, which isn't nearly sufficient. I need to pivot toward building a Full House instead, since that's the highest-leveled hand available to me. If I can construct three of a kind paired with another pair and ensure all four suits are represented for the Flower Pot multiplier, that gives me the best chance. Looking at what's left in the deck—one Queen, one Jack, one Ace, three Kings, three 2s, and three 3s—I should focus on keeping my existing pairs and discarding everything else to chase a three-of-a-kind. d aim for getting cards that could form a Full House with all four suits.

I'm reconsidering my strategy since this is the final hand. A Full House would be stronger than just three of a kind, so I should focus on building toward that instead of settling for a simple pair plus three of a kind.
